>>33596947
... but... here's something I didn't learn from any book that works. The power it releases will not necessarily be extreme but it's powerful enough to notice. You have to maintain self control even while your mind pushes you to take actions outside your comfort zone.

Try this. This is simple and actually works:

Grab some paper and a pen or pencil. Focus on an issue you are having that you want solved or changed. Simply write down 15 or so (length doesn't matter too much) lines of inspired text about the problem... way over the top inspired text.

For example, instead of writing:
I want to gain the courage to drive on the freeway.
Write this instead: By the power of all the spirit and gods aligned to myself and my ultimate purpose, and by the power of (name deity here), give me thine blessed power to gain the power to drive on the freeway!

Etc. etc. Write about a half a page worth of this stuff. Then read it to yourself, or whisper it, with as much passion as you can muster.

What you may find is that in a few hours or so... the effects will begin to emerge up out of your deeper mind and start to flood and overwhelm your conscious mind in the form of emotions and desires to take actions.

You have to learn to control these floods from the deep mind in the same way you might control your anger so you don't take any self-destructive acts.

Simple technique. Usually works for me. Slightly dangerous if you can't control your emotions.

Ok OP I'll try to give you my 2 cents on it.

First off, ignore the people trying to tell you you're living your life wrong, do whatever you want to do, be it no fap, or whatever else.

I feel like looking at this problem from the perspective of dreams in general. The act of controlling one's dreams is known as lucid dreaming. To achieve this state some will practice reality checks throughout the day (make a habit of noticing your wakefulness, "pinch yourself" and reaffirm to yourself that this is not a dream). If you do this and develop a habit of it, it will persist into your dreams.

Once you've laid that groundwork, you might be able to set up basically a flagging system in your brain so that when those sort of dreams happen, you fall into the pattern of reality checking, and then you could potentially guide the dream in another direction, or wake yourself up entirely.


You could even tie these reality checks in with any time you see or experience something that could be arousing. Any time you see something like that, you perform your reality check, and this creates an anchor in your mind. The more you make this connection while awake, the more likely it is to work in your dreams.

Good luck

Memory issues, I felt like my life was guided by hidden hands and a script, if I tried to say something I wasn't supposed to, that person would be pulled out of the body and everything would be ripped out of my head, then other things would flood back in. I would find myself on autopilot saying and doing what I was supposed to. If I tried to really go against the script, I would wake up having lost my voice so I could not speak, it would return later. I used to have this thing where I would get home, it always started the same way, I'd see a single vertical line through my vision (like a drip from the ceiling). Gradually become disoriented, then a sensation of terror, I was surrounded by this force that seemed far more powerful than me, I felt like I was submerged in a sea of limbs, reaching through me, rummaging around in my head. Other shit where I would be trying to sleep and feel long limbs extending down from the sky, reaching through my skull. I would only feel some measure of what I suppose I'd call safety, going to the basement and sitting on cement. Near the woodstove, as it would happen. For many years I felt threatened by vertical lines. A stove pipe, a broom leaning up in the corner, a string hanging from the ceiling. Circles as well, felt like I was looking at a ring but also inside of it. I remember building a framework for common memory between states. I created a river Lethe and a wonderland of sorts, using fragmentation and modularity. Lot of dreams, numbers, names.

Etc. This is just one small aspect. Experienced switching and all manner of other oddities. I was either set up, maimed, and pushed into, or simply made use of these internal systems and expanded them later. I could compartmentalize and keep up appearances, however.

Went away gradually after.... 25 or so. Stopped eating rice, the final grain.

com:
ST, or the Straightened Theory, is an extension of Correspondence Theory & Truthmaker Theory, that encompasses the cosmological, teleological, & ontological arguments.

The human sources of knowledge according to ST are threefold: (sound sense perception, reliable reporting, and logic & reasoning).
Human reason is limited, and can lead to errors, biases, & false assumptions; reason cannot be the sole source of truth, but instinctively recognizes necessary & self-evident truths.
In order to attain the highest epistemological certainty, knowledge must be transmitted in a massively recurrent fashion.

One of the key features of ST is its emphasis on the intuitive deduction of the existence of the Necessary Being (NB) from its principles.
The Causal Principle (CP), the Principle of Sufficient Reason (PSR), and the Classical Laws of Logic (CLL), lead to the intuitive deduction of the existence of the NB, as the ultimate source of moral values and principles and cause of the emergence of temporal events and existents. By ST, true religion must exist with true moral guidance as the NB is the ultimate cause of the emergence of temporal events and existents, and is the source of moral values and principles.

ST is aligned with the PSR, which states that everything must have a sufficient reason for its existence. In the context of ST, the NB serves as the sufficient reason for the existence of necessary truths & the emergence of temporal events.

ST posits that necessary truths, such as logical & mathematical truths, must be grounded in an immaterial, eternal Will which subsists in the NB. This NB is the ultimate cause of the emergence of temporal events and existents, and is not a material or emergent being; the NB is not Will.

ST is also aligned with the CLL, as it does not contradict or oppose them. In fact, ST provides a comprehensive explanation for the grounding of necessary truths and the emergence of temporal events, which the Classical framework alone cannot do.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33595688
Truths in ST can be classified into two categories: necessary truths and emergent truths.
Necessary truths are grounded in the NB and cannot be negated by any other being or entity; their negation entails a contradiction.
Emergent truths are grounded in material causes and can be negated by other material causes; they can be negated without contradiction.
ST is compatible with the CLL, the CP, and compatible with the epistemological framework of true religion; it does not contradict or oppose the concept of revelation or the roles of revelation and human reason.

In summary, ST is a coherent and comprehensive epistemological framework that explains the grounding of necessary truths and the emergence of temporal events, while being aligned with the PSR, the Classical Laws of Logic, the Principle of Causality, and true religion.
It provides a clear and intuitive understanding of the nature of truth and the world we live in.


The Principles of ST are as follows:
* The human sources of knowledge are three: (sound sense perception, reliable reporting, and logic & reasoning)

* The mind possesses necessary knowledge of the external reality mediated to it by the senses, of its own innate logical principles, and of whatever has reached it by way of massively recurrent transmission.

* The intuitive experience is the mind using innate knowledge to abstract universal concepts, from empirical knowledge provided, to form judgments (impressions) of what it holds as mental representations of external reality.

* Just as sensory perception allows us to gather information about the world around us, reliable reporting allows us to gather accurate and consistent information from others. In both cases, the more reliable the sense we use and the more reliable the source, the more certain we can be about the information we are receiving, and the impression it forms.
